title: Elegant Humanist Serifs
content: Can anyone suggest some good resources on the web, where one could take a look at some more unique typefaces? Maybe even links to some well respected type foundries? Anything would be a great help!
author: oodko

comments.content:
For links to foundries, try these links...

[http://www.typo.cz/\_pismo/pis-dig-odkazy-al.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.typo.cz/_pismo/pis-dig-odkazy-al.html "http://www.typo.cz/\_pismo/pis-dig-odkazy-al.html")  
 [http://www.typo.cz/\_pismo/pis-dig-odkazy-mz.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.typo.cz/_pismo/pis-dig-odkazy-mz.html "http://www.typo.cz/\_pismo/pis-dig-odkazy-mz.html")

You can also use these online shops:

[http://www.myfonts.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.myfonts.com/ "http://www.myfonts.com/")  
 [http://www.fonts.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.fonts.com/ "http://www.fonts.com/")  
 [http://www.fontshop.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.fontshop.com/ "http://www.fontshop.com")  
 [http://www.philsfonts.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.philsfonts.com/ "http://www.philsfonts.com/")  
 [http://www.veer.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.veer.com/ "http://www.veer.com/")  
 [http://www.fonthaus.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.fonthaus.com/ "http://www.fonthaus.com/")  
 [http://www.faces.co.uk](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.faces.co.uk/ "http://www.faces.co.uk")  
 [http://www.type.co.uk/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.type.co.uk/ "http://www.type.co.uk/")  
 [http://www.paratype.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.paratype.com/ "http://www.paratype.com")  
 [http://www.fontfactory.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.fontfactory.com/ "http://www.fontfactory.com/")  
 [http://vllg.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/vllg.com/ "http://vllg.com/")  
 [http://www.typetrust.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.typetrust.com/ "http://www.typetrust.com/")  
 [http://www.fontmarketplace.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.fontmarketplace.com/ "http://www.fontmarketplace.com/")  
 [http://www.graphicobsession.fr/index.jsp?media=type](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.graphicobsession.fr/index.jsp?media=type "http://www.graphicobsession.fr/index.jsp?media=type")

You're in for a long slog. There is simply so much out there that it's better to start by describing what you want, such as: "I need

- a sturdy, rugged serif for newspaper text"
- a casual, friendly script with a nod to the American fifities."
- heavy sans serif typefaces that look like they were hand drawn with a pen or brush."

With more specific requirements we can be much more helpful with recommendations.

Thank you for the links loremipsum, very helpful!

I suppose specifically I'm looking for a more elegant, humanist serif typeface. I'm going to be creating brand guidelines for a fairly high-end party planner, so I'm looking for some quality 'old-fashioned' typefaces that can still look contemporary enough.
I think I have something that might meet the description, but it's not ready yet.

\> elegant, humanist serif typeface. quality ’old-fashioned’ typefaces that can still look contemporary enough.

Now we're talkin'.

[Borgues](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1048&c=4&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=CTT0000007)  
 [FF Maiola](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_maiola_ot/)  
 [MVB Verdigris](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/mvb_fonts/mvb_verdigris/)  
 [Farnham](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/font_bureau/farnham_text/)  
 [Delicato](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fountain/delicato/)  
 [Galliard](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/carter_cone/itc_galliard_cc/)  
 [Swift](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Swift)  
 [Fresco](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Fresco%20OT)  
 [Freight](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/garagefonts/freight_text/)  
 [Eason](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fountain/eason/)  
 [Le Monde](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/porchez/le_monde_journal/)  
 [Brioso](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1048&c=4&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=ADT0002940)  
 [Relato](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/emtype/relato_family/)  
 [Lineare](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ert/lineare/?refby=typographica)  
 [Dolly](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/underware/dolly/)  
 [Prensa](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Prensa)
Thanks Stephen! Looked through them all. The list was super helpful. For some reason, I like Eason... but I may have to take another look later today.

And [Whitman](http://web.archive.org/web/20120312002108/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Whitman) is nice - and according to the designer, Kent Lew, more weights, including display weights, are soon to be released.
